file_content.text: This lounge is private. You'll have to leave--but have a nice time in the casino.
Go. Just go.
Master Tlan is dying!
You really shouldn't stay here much longer.
Master Tlan requested my repairs be completed in time for tomorrow's swoop race broadcast. You are supposed to comply.
I'm not a mechanic. I can't keep repairing you--things--when you malfunction.
Then I shall inform Master Tlan of your inability to perform your duties.
That's not necessary! I--why don't you clear your memory of the last five minutes?
Hey. You--this is Master Tlan's lounge. There something I can help you with?
You've got your hands full with that protocol unit.
Having droid problems?
It's nothing big. Master Tlan just likes everything to be perfect.
The JT-02 is a Geonosian antique. JT-03's blasters need recalibration... the serving droid spills drinks....
The droids are why I'm here. Do you mind?
Let me see them.
What do you want? Master Tlan didn't say anyone was coming.
I've got a repair order from the casino. There've been some complaints.
I'm with maintenance.
Fine, okay. We don't need any trouble. Just be quick, okay?
You've got my sympathy.
Sorry to hear it.
Stop whining.
Look, you don't need to mock me.
I hope I'm not intruding. What's your name?
Hello there.
I'm Netula Pahn. I assist Master Jordel Tlan, tend to his lounge and the droids.
I take it you work for Jordel Tlan?
Master Tlan?
That's right. I take care of his lounge and his droids.
It's a pretty nice gig. When Tlan left the business world, he picked me up--bailed me out of debt. Now I work for one of the richest men on Nar Shaddaa.
Can you arrange a meeting for me?
I need to see him.
You sound devoted. I hope he treats you well.
[Flirt] Must get lonely.
Tlan? Not like you're thinking. Might be nice to be treated well again.
I bet working for Tlan has its advantages.
Sounds like you're set.
He doesn't--it's not like that. And he owns my debt, so he doesn't bother paying me.
Tell me about Tlan's time in business.
How'd he get rich?
Like I said, I wasn't there for much. He was getting ready to leave Synchet Industries when he found me.
Look, don't take this wrong--but I don't know you, and no one comes in here just to talk. What's this about?
I need to take a look at your serving unit.
Can I see the droids?
JT-05? Don't tell me it's making trouble in the casino.
There've been a few complaints--running into customers, that sort of thing. Maintenance sent me.
It needs repairs.
Ugh. Sorry for the trouble. Please, do what you have to.
This is Hutt Cartel business. Droids need to be checked for security.
Management sent me.
What? I didn't think you were--sorry.
I don't know what you expect to find in the serving droid, but yes, go ahead. Master Tlan has nothing to hide.
I'm in the market for a new serving droid, myself. I thought I'd take a look.
Call it shopping.
Master Tlan is very choosy about his droids--I doubt you'll find another like it, but go ahead.
Now, I've got to get back to the JT-02. Blasted thing....
I need to talk to your employer, and I think he'll want to talk to me.
I want a meeting with Tlan.
Maybe I just enjoy your company.
[Flirt] It's about you.
Mm. Somehow I doubt I'm who you're really interested in. Not that I'm complaining about the attention.
Let's get away from here. I'll prove how interested I am.
[Flirt] Then enjoy it.
Ha! I suppose the droids can look after themselves for a while. We could slip down to the cantina for a little bit?
Meet you back here; there's a bounty hunter in the casino who keeps eyeing me. I can show him a few things....
You two have fun. I'd come with, but she's a little sweet for my taste.
Okay. I needed that. I should definitely get out more.
But I'm still curious--what's this all for? Let me in on the mystery.
I can't tell you, but I do need your help.
It's confidential.
Not words I've heard a lot. Okay.
I'm afraid your boss is involved with criminals.
Your master's in trouble.
Tlan doesn't even leave his room. I mean, I know he did some weird deals back in the day....
Okay. I guess you are serious.
The Empire has questions for Jordel Tlan.
Imperial business.
You're Imperial? Not that I have anything against you guys, I'm just... surprised.
You know I can't betray Tlan. But... I can go behind his back a little. If you like.
I need to know if Synchet Industries dealt with terrorists. I thought Tlan might know.
It's about business dealings.
Terrorists? Synchet was pretty innocent, as corporations go. And Tlan wasn't political.
Things did get a little weird toward the end. After the war, Tlan and his partners were desperate to sell.
They sold Synchet off one division at a time--mostly to other companies, but one group of buyers creeped me out.
Can you tell me about the buyers?
Buyers?
A little. I can try.
This sounds useful--keep going.
Interesting.
So what?
Look, I'm trying to help. If you don't want it, you don't have to listen.
I don't know who the buyers were, but they didn't act like businessmen. Still, they had credits, and they wanted to deal.
They were after a Synchet subdivision--some medical company. I don't know why, and I don't think Tlan cared.
That sounds like the people I'm after.
Jackpot.
Has Tlan been in contact with them since?
What about now?
I doubt it. He's retired--not a threat to anyone. Probably doesn't even remember the old buyers.
I need more to go on than vague descriptions.
That's insufficient.
I think the branch they bought was called VerveGen? Something like that. Like I said, it made medical supplies.
I don't know what else I can tell you. But don't worry... I won't say anything to Tlan.
I'll give you a call next time I'm on Nar Shaddaa.
Maybe we can meet again?
Sure. You don't have to say it.
Watch out, all right? And take care.
Be well.
You, too. Dangerous planet out there.
We're finished.
Right. I... think I get it.
I think only Tlan can tell me what I need.
He knows what I want.
Oh. If that's true--I can get you in, tell him you're a business partner. Wait here.
Can you set me up to meet with Tlan?
I need to see him.
Probably. If that's what you really want. Wait here.
Okay. You're all set. I hope this works out for you--I really do.
Go through that door. And please be careful of Tlan and his droids--don't get too close, and don't get him mad.
I owe you, Netula. You've been wonderful.
Thank you.
Yeah, I know. Just--forget it. You'll do great.
Of course.
Good luck in there. I know you'll do great.
I don't care.
Right. Yes. Thanks.
You're right. What I really need is a way to your master.
Tlan's my real interest.
Whatever you say.
The truth comes out.
You don't know who you're dealing with. Tlan doesn't take visitors; I'm the only person he's seen in a year.
Jordel Tlan and I have some... history together.
He's an old acquaintance.
Really? Ha! I don't know if I should believe that or not.
Even if I wanted to set you up with a meeting--and I don't, sorry--what would I tell him? Some stranger wants to chat?
For this, I'm sure you can come up with something.
Will credits convince you?
Well... I could use a little spending money. Wait here, and I'll see what I can do.
All right. Master Tlan is willing to see you.
Tell him an old friend wants to talk about Cyclone.
It's about a medical serum.
If you say so. I'll give him the message and see what he wants to do.
Well. Says he'll talk to you. Wouldn't plan on an extended visit, though.
Go through that door, keep your distance from Tlan and the droids, and don't take too long. Got it?
I'm not planning on causing any trouble.
Got it.
Thanks.
Finally.
Just be careful in there.
If you don't cooperate, I'll do this the hard way.
Don't mess with me.
You do that. But I hope that isn't a threat--I can have half the casino guards in here in seconds.
Enjoy the lounge, if you want--just don't stay too long. As for me, I have a droid to repair.
I'm sorry, but you can't be here. This is Master Tlan's private lounge.
I'm short on credits, but I could compensate you after I bargain with Tlan.
I'll pay you later.
Sorry. It doesn't work that way.
